paragraphs.text: Our products will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use at the initial site of installation. This warranty is applicable to the original consumer purchaser for as long as they own their home and is non-transferable.

This limited warranty does not cover damage caused by exposure to moisture, exposure to extreme temperatures, acts of God, improper storage, handling, installation, misuse, abuse, neglect nor does it cover normal incidental deterioration such as nicks, scratches, abrasions and natural aging whether resulting from the effects of normal wear and tear or abnormal use.
Problems with wood due to temperature and humidity (as described below in the Wood Characteristics section) will not be covered by this warranty.
Any expense involved in removing, shipping, and reinstalling any items or products will not be covered by this warranty.
Nickels Cabinets reserves the option of approving field repair or returning the part to the factory for correction.
We will not assume, nor authorize any person to assume for us, any liability in connection with the sale of Nickels Cabinets products.
This warranty is in lieu of all other warranties expressed or implied.

items.title: Wood Characteristics
items.description: Wood has long been admired for its distinct and unique characteristics.

paragraphs.text: All wood species undergo a gradual aging process that will enhance the texture, color, and grain patterns in the wood. The pronounced features of each wood species give a uniqueness and timeless appeal that can only be found in nature. These characteristics are particularly evident with our lighter stained finishes. While we make every effort to ensure that all of our finishes are consistent with our samples, variations in graining, knots, mineral deposits, and color are inherent in wood and are considered acceptable.
According to the Architectural Woodwork Institute:

"Wood is a hygroscopic material, and under normal use conditions all wood products contain some moisture. Wood readily exchanges this molecular moisture with the water vapor in the surrounding atmosphere according to the existing relative humidity. In high humidity, wood picks up moisture and swells; in low humidity wood releases moisture and shrinks. As normal minor fluctuations in humidity occur, the resulting dimensional response in properly designed construction will be insignificant. To avoid problems, it is recommended that relative humidity be maintained within the range of 25 - 55%. Uncontrolled extremes - below 20% or above 80% relative humidity - can likely cause problems."

Nickels takes great care to maintain an environment that falls within the acceptable range for wood products. As such, any problems that occur after the product has left our facility will not be covered by our warranty, but will become the responsibility of the storage company prior to installation, the general contractor during site storage and installation, or the homeowner after occupancy.

Nickels typically applies paint onto one-piece or two-piece MDF doors in order to avoid the problem of cracks developing on the door faces. When a 5-piece door is painted, the joints will inevitably telegraph through the painted finish. On some occasions, the joints will open up, thereby developing hairline cracks on the door face. These cracks in the joints are considered normal and acceptable, and are therefore not covered as a warranty issue.

Nickels Cabinets have been certified by the CKCA, and as such, the standards set by the CKCA shall determine the maximum warp for doors. Any warp within these tolerances will be considered normal and acceptable, and therefore not covered as a warranty issue.
CKCA 4.2.5

Doors - Maximum warp - Doors less than 32" (812mm) in height shall have a maximum deflection of 3/32" (2.5mm). Any door greater than 32" in height shall have a maximum deflection of 3/16" (5mm). 5-piece wood doors 50" (1270mm) or greater in height should have a mid-rail. Doors shall also be installed and aligned so that they are square with the cabinet and can operate freely without excessive looseness or binding. Installed doors shall have a device sufficient to hold the door closed.

Cabinets or parts will be replaced on a ‘Quick Ship’ basis. Replacement materials will be invoiced according to their market price. Credit will be issued after the defective material has been returned and an inspection by Nickels deems the material to be defective.

Cabinets and parts must be inspected prior to installation as Nickels Cabinets will not cover any expense involved in removing or reinstalling the product. All products will undergo a quality inspection at our plant prior to shipping in an effort to ensure satisfactory receipt of goods. Nickels will not be responsible for any freight damage or lost product. Claims for such problems must be made directly to the carrier involved.
To file a warranty claim, the purchaser should contact the local authorized Nickels Cabinets Dealer who will assist in servicing the claim.

All cabinet materials, particularly finished wood and painted products, demand your care and attention. Caution must be taken to protect your cabinetry from extremes of temperature and exposure to moisture. Any prolonged exposure to moisture, whether liquid or steam, is likely to cause damage, so proper care is required in order to maintain the finish on your cabinetry. It is important to wipe off any excessive moisture when it occurs, particularly around the sink, stove, dishwasher, and shower areas where high humidity is typical. Such conditions can accelerate the natural expansion and contraction of the wood fibers that may cause irreparable damage and will void your warranty.

According to the Architectural Woodwork Institute, "Wood is a hygroscopic material, and under normal use conditions all wood products contain some moisture. Wood readily exchanges this molecular moisture with the water vapor in the surrounding atmosphere according to the existing relative humidity. In high humidity, wood picks up moisture and swells; in low humidity wood releases moisture and shrinks. As normal minor fluctuations in humidity occur, the resulting dimensional response in properly designed construction will be insignificant. To avoid problems, it is recommended that relative humidity be maintained within the range of 25 - 55%. Uncontrolled extremes - below 20% or above 80% relative humidity - can likely cause problems."

Nickels takes great care to maintain an environment that falls within the acceptable range for wood products and this responsibility is passed on to you once our product has reached your home. Please be sure to maintain the relative humidity levels as recommended above.

Cleaning solutions can also be a hazard. Although our finishes are resistant to normal household chemicals (as verified by our CKCA certification), excessive and prolonged exposure may cause a discolouration in the surface. Abrasives and furniture polishes should never be used, particularly those that are silicone-based and/or contain citric acid.

For regular cleaning, we recommend wiping with a clean, soft cloth slightly dampened with a solution of mild detergent and warm water, followed by another wipe with a clean,dry soft cloth. Never use a dishcloth that is not clean as it may contain contaminants that could damage the cabinetry. It is important to wipe in the direction of the grain if you have a wood product. We do advise you allow a minimum of 30 days prior to cleaning with the cleaning solution to allow the surfaces to fully harden.
With proper care you will get many years of enjoyment out of your cabinetry.
Nickels Cabinets has designed the Webquoin ordering software to assist the Dealer in completing all details prior to placing an order with the Nickels Order Desk.
The following information must be entered into Webquoin to enable the placement of an order:
Dealer Name
Dealer PO#
Job Name (Customer)
Shipping Address (unless picking up)
The following information must be included with the Webquoin report to complete the placement of an order:
Floorplan (and elevations) with dimentions (not architectural drawings)
Custom Drawings (if any)
In the event that an entire order is cancelled after a Dealer has given Nickels a confirmation for that order, the following policy will take effect:

Nickels will determine the total costs incurred for the order up to the date it is cancelled. These costs will be passed on to the Dealer who will be fully responsible to pay Nickels for these costs. The costs could include materials prepared or assembled for the order as well as time spent by the Order Desk person, Engineering person, and all Production people involved.
There will be a restocking fee on a case by case basis for any outsourced parts that are either cancelled or returned.

If a deposit has been paid, Nickels will reimburse the difference to the Dealer. Any charges above the pre-paid amount will be billed to the Dealer and payment will be collected in the normal fashion.
Items that need to be fixed or replaced will fall into one of the following four situations:
The item was made incorrectly by Nickels Cabinets - Nickels will do whatever is necessary to rectify the problem as soon as possible at Nickels expense.
The item was ordered incorrectly or needs to be fixed due to Dealer error - the item will be replaced or fixed as soon as possible and charged to the Dealer.

The item has a manufacturing defect - these items need to be returned to Nickels in order to have the defective product replaced. If so deemed by Nickels, the item will be replaced at no charge once the defective goods are examined. If the item in question does not get returned to Nickels, the cost of the replacement item will be charged to the Dealer.

The item was damaged during shipping - if Nickels arranged shipping, then the item should be returned to Nickels immediately with the receipt of damaged product so Nickels can file a claim with the shipping company. If the damaged product is not returned, the Dealer will be charged for the replacement item. If the Dealer has arranged their own shipping, claims must be made directly by the Dealer to their shipping company.

In order to complete the job installation as soon as possible, Nickels Cabinets should be notified when a problem is noticed. Nickels Cabinets reserves the right to decide which items will be charged to the Dealer.
As with all other orders, job information should be filled out in full. The Dealer must request the replacement parts or fix up items by fax or email.
Phone orders will NOT be accepted.
Priority is given to these items and will be labelled ‘Quick Ship’ for production.

Nickels Cabinets was established in 1979 as a family owned and operated business. Since that time, our commitment to the principals of excellence in craftsmanship, customized design, timely delivery and competitive pricing have formed the foundation of our company.
Our mission is to provide value through our assurance of consistent quality and service.
Fit: Nickels cabinets are available in 8" width increments which allows you to fit cabinetry within your client’s wall space with minimal use of fillers.
A wide range of cabinet configurations and heights are standard with our product line. Click on any of the following cabinet types for more information: Base, Vanity, Tall, Wall.
Cabinets are available in 8" height increments. Click here to see the range of standard coded cabinets as well as the optional sizes available.

Finish: Nickels offers a palette of stains and paint colors that reflects current trends. In addition, Nickels offers a custom color program that allows us to match stains and paints to your client’s specific needs. Click here to see the Finishes Section of the catalog.

For You: Nickels builds on a per order basis which means the cabinets are made specifically for your client’s home by our dedicated team of crafts people. We do not mass-produce boxes, we do not stock prefabricated cabinets in a warehouse, and our cabinets can only be purchased through our select network of authorized Dealers.
Cabinets are doweled, glued and case clamped to achieve strength and accuracy.
All cabinets are constructed using 5/8" backs (3/4" available as well) and gables that are dadoed into the cabinet sides to maintain square ness.
Exposed end gables are a matching melamine, MDF or wood veneer either painted or stained, sealed and top-coated to match the doors.
Hinges are Blum clip-top BLUMOTION, 110 degree, 3-way adjustable, all metal, fully concealed, and are backed by Blum’s lifetime guarantee.
All drawer hardware is by Blum and comes with a lifetime guarantee.
See our drawer page for all available drawers
See our materials page for all available materials
See our doors page for all available doorstyles
All materials are CARB II compliant: formaldehyde emitted <0.05 ppm for plywood, <0.09 ppm for particleboard, <0.11 ppm for MDF

Nickels will arrange trucking, schedule and prepay all related costs. Nickels will process and pay for all border brokerage charges. For this service, Nickels will charge according to the delivery location. These delivery rates are programmed into your Webquoin software according to your location. Rates are based on current trucking charges and may change without warning.

Nickels will produce orders and stay in contact with the Dealer regarding pick up schedule. Nickels will arrange trucking with the Dealer’s preferred firm, but will not pay for any transportation charges. Nickels will load the truck and prepare border documentation, but will not pay for brokerage fees. The Dealer is responsible to set up an account with a brokerage firm. Nickels recommends Border Brokerage as all documents will be prepared using their software.

SWOG can be used when you need to add product to an existing scheduled delivery to a specified location. The product can be for the original job, or from a different job, as long as it is delivered at the same time and to the same location as part of a previously scheduled complete order. The Order Desk will verify that the minimum delivery charges have been covered and that you can use SWOG as a delivery option.

Drop Fee will allow you to include additional drop points for products within the same delivery zone, and on the same delivery route. The Order Desk will verify your drop shipment address to be sure the charges are correct. If the shipment address is outside of the delivery zone or route (as determined by our trucking companies) then the standard shipping fees will be applied to your order.

delivery times are based on the volume of production in the shop. The approximate Order Desk wait times and Production lead times will be posted on the message board in Webquoin. In general, the following guidelines will apply:
Regular Orders
Regular Orders will be scheduled for shipping based on Nickels production time see Webquoin.
Certain special finishes and materials may increase the lead times required.
If the lead time changes, the Dealer will be notified through the Webquoin system.
Quick Ship - Orders with Doors
These orders are for miscellaneous items that are needed in a hurry to complete a job.
Can include items like damaged cabinets, moldings, missed fillers, etc.
These orders can be used for an order for Dealer sample products.
NOT available for ordering cabinets that were not on the original order
These orders will be labeled as "Quick Ship" and will be scheduled for shipping in a minimum of 12 working days.
Quick Ship - Orders without Doors
These orders are for miscellaneous items that are needed in a hurry to complete a job.
Can include items like damaged moldings, missed fillers, etc.
NOT available for ordering cabinets that were not on the original order
These orders will be labeled "Quick Ship" and will be scheduled for shipping in a minimum of 5 working days.
NOTE: These are on confirmed orders.
Dealers may request earlier shipping dates, however, Nickels Cabinets cannot guarantee that the product will be shipped any sooner than the above lead times.
An approximate delivery time will be given through Webquoin shortly after confirmation.  This is the date the Dealer should expect the cabinets to be shipped.
All orders are FOB Nickels, Richmond BC warehouse. Nickels will offer 2 options for processing and shipping orders to the final destination: Prepaid & Charge (using ground transportation) or Collect.

Dealers may also request delivery of small orders/parts by courier, either with air or ground service. If so requested, the dealer must provide their courier account information and Nickels will take care of all the required paperwork and contact with the courier. This method will be done at the dealers expense and if required, ground or air service must be specified when placing the order.

Dieter Nickel convinced his dad, Peter, to join him in building a cabinet company that would have its beginnings in a garage in Richmond, British Columbia. Right from the start, the value of hard and honest work and the strength of the Nickel name was drilled into the core of our brand. Our mission is to provide value through our assurance of consistent quality and service.
Time and technology have brought many changes to Nickels Cabinets, but one thing has remained true
--discerning clients rely on us to care about the details required for exceptional cabinetwork.
At Nickels our staff are steadfastly committed to this goal.
